pageContext.claim: “And again, I don't blame President Xi. I blame our past leaders for allowing it to happen for so many years with the World Trade Organization. China was totally flat-lined. And when the World Trade Organization came about and China joined the World Trade, they became a rocket ship, because, you know, it's a very unfair situation that took place at the World Trade Organization, as are many of them.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, China's economy was booming even before it entered the WTO in 2001. According to the World Bank, China grew by 7.7 percent in 1999, 8.5 percent in 2000 and 8.3 percent in 2001. It then grew by 9.1 percent in 2002, 10.0 percent in 2003 and 10.1 percent in 2004.
